title: Unbeaten Pinatubo can make it six out of six in Darley Dewhurst Stakes at Newmarket
text:
Pinatubo, Godolphin’s unbeaten Shamardal colt who is already rated higher than Frankel at the same stage, can make it six out of six by winning the Darley Dewhurst Stakes at Newmarket on Saturday.

Having won at Wolverhampton, Epsom, Royal Ascot, Goodwood and a Curragh Group One by an astonishing nine lengths, Newmarket’s Rowley Mile is unlikely to faze the season’s most exciting juvenile.

And, though one or two notable long-margin winners should have come with a health warning next time out, his win was in a Group One, the form of which has since been franked. It appears only a deluge leading to soft ground would present a question he has yet to be asked.

Godolphin is finishing the season on a high both on the racecourse and, earlier this week, in the sales ring. It has won the Middle Park with Earthlight, the Jean-Luc Lagardere with Victor Ludorum and the National Stakes with this colt. The Dewhurst would give it the clean sweep.

“He’s very exciting for us and for racing,” said Pinatubo’s trainer, Charlie Appleby on Friday. “I’m very happy with him. He’s strengthened with each race since Ascot. He’s not going 10 lengths clear on the gallops but he never has.”
description: Pinatubo, Godolphin’s unbeaten Shamardal colt who is already rated higher than Frankel at the same stage, can make it six out of six by winning the Darley Dewhurst Stakes at Newmarket on Saturday.
